Package br.com.kirgh.app.repositories

Interface ApplianceRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Appliance,UUID>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Appliance,UUID>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Appliance,UUID>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Appliance,UUID>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Appliance,UUID>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Appliance>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Appliance,UUID>
public interface ApplianceRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Appliance,UUID>
This code is defining an interface called ApplianceRepository that extends the JpaRepository interface. The JpaRepository interface is a Spring Data interface that provides methods for performing CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on entities. The ApplianceRepository interface is specifying that it will work with the Appliance entity and use a UUID as the type for the entity's ID. This interface will allow the application to perform database operations on the Appliance entity using Spring Data's built-in methods.

  • Method Details

    • findAll

      org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Appliance> findAll(org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.Specification spec, org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageRequest)
      The function returns a page of Appliance objects that match the given Specification and are paginated according to the given Pageable object.
      Parameters:
      spec - The "spec" parameter is a Specification object that represents the criteria or conditions to be used for filtering the results of the query. It allows you to dynamically build complex queries by combining multiple conditions using logical operators such as AND and OR.
      pageRequest - Pageable is an interface that represents a request for a specific page of data. It includes information such as the page number, page size, and sorting criteria.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a Page object containing a list of Appliance objects that match the given Specification, with pagination applied according to the provided Pageable object.

    • getAllAppliancesBoundAddress

      @Query(nativeQuery=true, value=" SELECT\n appliances.id, appliances.name, appliances.brand, appliances.model, appliances.power\n FROM\n appliances\n INNER JOIN\n appliance_relations\n ON\n appliances.id = appliance_relations.appliance_id\n WHERE\n appliance_relations.address_id = :addressId\n") List<ApplianceProjection> getAllAppliancesBoundAddress(@Param("addressId") UUID addressId)
      The function retrieves a list of appliances that are bound to a specific address.
      Parameters:
      addressId - The addressId parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that is used to identify a specific address. It is used in the query to filter the appliances based on the address they are bound to.
      Returns:
      The query is returning a list of ApplianceProjection objects.

    • deleteAppliancesByAddressId

      @Transactional @Modifying @Query(nativeQuery=true, value=" DELETE FROM\n appliances\n WHERE id\n IN(\n SELECT\n appliances.id\n FROM\n appliances\n INNER JOIN\n appliance_relations\n ON\n appliances.id = appliance_relations.appliance_id\n WHERE\n appliance_relations.address_id = :addressId\n )\n") void deleteAppliancesByAddressId(@Param("addressId") UUID addressId)
      The code snippet you provided is a method declaration in the ApplianceRepository interface. This method is using Spring Data's @Transactional, @Modifying, and @Query annotations to define a custom delete operation.
      Parameters:
      addressId - The addressId parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents the unique identifier of the address to be deleted.
